ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Garner an in-depth understanding of autism---everything from its genetics to therapies to the experience being a parent or sibling of a child with ASD.
Learned about autism through many perspectives. Got to have hands on learning experience every week at the placement
Knowledge about autism spectrum disorder and the services and community that support people with ASD
topics on autism and practical knowledge in real life shared by guest speakers
Knowledge of autism.
A really great, well-rounded introduction to autism and relevant areas related to the field
This course provided a general introduction to the field of autism and gave students a chance to participate in field work with elderly and youth with autism.
A greater understanding of the diagnosis/intervention practices for Autism.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: the placement! I really enjoyed my placement and found it to be the highlight of the week. Weaknesses: the room was often very cold. I also wished I got to hear about the placements of the other students at some point. I wouldnt mind submitting a weekly reflection about my placement, and maybe the prof could select a couple each week to share and discuss with the class.
Strengths--wonderful guest lecturers and overall learned a lot from the course. Could be more structured in what Prof Volkmar would like us to get out of each lecture.

Strengths: Professor Volkmar is a great lecturer who really loves his field of study. He always made lecture interesting and brought in a number of guest speakers who really enriched the course. 

Weaknesses: None
Course was amazing all around. One of the strengths was the weekly placement and another strength was prof Volkmar
So great.

the placement is definitely a highlight of the course, and it really makes you have a more vivid understanding of the course knowledge
class itself could be made more engaging other than lectures, but guest speakers are really fascinating
Dr. Volkmar is great. Its a very personal class. It allows you to follow your own interests within the broad scope of topics introduced

Strengths: practical component that brings lessons into focus (very fun and informative); lots of different guest speakers who give full presentation of field of working/researching autism 

Weaknesses: a little unstructured, guest speakers are hit or miss, not a lot of opportunities for group discussion, practical component work places are highly varied (its a lot of what you make of it)
Great course. Wonderful professor who really made the class feel fun, friendly. He cared. He invited us to brunch. Those things were nice. Not common at Yale; it means the world.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! It broadens your understanding of developmental disabilities and the placement is one of the best opportunities that Yale provides.
100%. If you can get in definitely take this course
Yes for sure!!!
yes if you are interested in autism topics and want to have real experiences working with autism kids!!! Prof. Volkmar is really nice and approachable, and very experienced in this area
Absolutely! It is a great course.

I would if they are interested in autism/the field of caring for those with autism. However the course is quite low in terms of workload so a lot of the most meaningful work has to come out of practical component 

However, I left the clsss feeling a little unsatisfied. I think the course has a lot of potential but should be reworked to give more opportunity for learning and engagement.
Yes, definitely! I was already very interested in this topic, so I found the topics of lecture fascinating and the practicum was very fulfilling as well.
Yes, absolutely.
